intro: Stenogyne rotundifolia var. salebrosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a perennial shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mesic forests and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to rounded in shape, and the species is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture. It is also an important plant in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
